45) Stories We Tell (dir. Sarah Polley, 2012) #52FilmsByWomen https://t.co/YcLGhMFtLS
@MattWalshBlog 13) Because that’s all we’re talking about here - living in a world where we take care of each other.
@MattWalshBlog 12) might bring them something akin to the calm you feel knowing your world is secure.
@MattWalshBlog 11) and maybe, just maybe, consider that supporting them - empathizing with them . . .
@MattWalshBlog 10) that you give a thought to other folks, less off than you, or who need more than you, who get it less than you do . . .
@MattWalshBlog 9) and your heart is Grinching out 4 times too big looking down at that smile, basking in the glow of your family love . . .
@MattWalshBlog 8) And that when you’re holding your kid in your arms, now safe from harm . . .
@MattWalshBlog 8) And that when you’re holding your kid in your arms, now safe from harm . . .
@MattWalshBlog 7)I wish you’d think about the subsidies, the insurance breaks, the externalities that let you get the health care you get
@MattWalshBlog 6) So, first, I’d like to say that I hope everything turns out all right for your kid.
@MattWalshBlog 5) And I know that whatever kind of dick you might be on the surface, you’re probably hurting inside.
@MattWalshBlog 4) And I know how it is to have your child’s health in the hands of medical professionals who don’t keep you in the loop.
@MattWalshBlog 3) So I’ve been shitting on the bile stuff, but I’m also a dad of a sickly kid.
@aaron_m_hunter 4) And I know what it’s like to have your child’s health in the hands of med professionals who don’t keep you in the loop.
3) So I’ve been shitting on the bile stuff, but I’m also a dad of a sickly kid. https://t.co/4KcGMlFxXV
@MattWalshBlog 2) But you decided to drop your bile all over twitter tonight while your kid was sick. And that’s all kinds of fucked up.
@MattWalshBlog 1) Look, I don’t know you, and you don’t know me.
@MattWalshBlog Aha! you're on about condoms, not birth control. You're one of those "but baby, I just can't feel it" kind of guys, right?
@MattWalshBlog Unsurprisingly, you also don't know how to count . . .
@MattWalshBlog nope, don't change the subject, dillweed! You pay for what benefits you, screw the rest. That's the case here.
@MattWalshBlog Suppose you also drive on "not public" roads, breath "not public" clean air, too. Jesus fuck, who actually had kids with you?
@MattWalshBlog um, maybe the irony of you bitching about one medical situation while maligning another? How daft are you?
Conversely, I pity the life your kids will lead, you hateful knob! https://t.co/e7vJrXiTdC
@zacheney did it involve Joe Biden? a cat? the freest little kid you've ever seen? that dos equis guy? irony? emptiness you can't describe?
@melikhovo Oh, also, S5 of Lost is fantastic.
@waxbanks @melikhovo Just beat me to it!
@melikhovo Buffy mixes serial and episodic, and there's fan disagreements over season rankings, but S5 is definitely one of its best.

@GlasgowsDA @kinowords Exactly . . . it's a scam, just like quantitative easing and student loans!
@kinowords @GlasgowsDA and even that doesn't work! It's like that scene in Mad Max, when the water's released-most going home w/nada.
@GlasgowsDA Also, "quantitative easing" drives me nuts when so much is being cut. The nerve of them . . . "hmm, let's give it a fancy name!"
@GlasgowsDA was hard to imagine disliking anybody more than I did Osborne, but this lot now . . . yeesh!
@GlasgowsDA sort of amazes me how blatant they're being about it, and how easily they seem to be getting away with it. Smug. Grim.
@ohmeara Yes, reminds me of Northern Exposure in that way (without the fish-out-of-water, but with way more snark!)
@ohmeara I've just started my first time, abt 1/2way through S1, loving it even more than I'd thought I might.
@rcolintait ha ha . . . I've been singing random bits of it out loud all week!
@matt_boyd_smith @rcolintait yes! and plays so well and unexpectedly off every image, action, line of dialogue in the min. leading up to it.
@rcolintait Yes! 1st time I liked it but hard to see through all my cringing; teaching it this week opened my eyes to much greatness in it.
@matt_boyd_smith CT brings so much depth and pathos to what really could have been a 1D role.

Started #GilmoreGirls for the first time last week. Loving it. Dialogue as great as promised, but Graham's delivery is killer.
@pauseforthejet some of it fried, I hope!
@pauseforthejet ha, been there. At least in C/E europe, even the 'vegetarian' restaurants have meat! Hopefully you could compromise!
@pauseforthejet 've met plenty who wholeheartedly believe if there's no meat, it's absolutely not dinner, can't be.
@chutry Ha! yeah, that was a few years early! A definite mess, might be interesting for the place/people involved-if you like an '80s vibe!
@chutry Yes, so much talent. Sadly the leads bring it way down, and it's a tonal mess. Looks good, though (Deschanel's work is great).
